title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-Debt-Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This application allows individuals to track their sleep patterns, calculate their accumulated sleep debt, and potentially receive insights to improve their sleep habits. It's a practical TypeScript-based project focused on personal well-being and time management.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI), aiming to provide a platform for developers to showcase their projects and skills. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, incorporating modern web development practices with a focus on clean architecture and maintainable code, covering topics like component-based design and server-side rendering.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files, built using a combination of JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. This project provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS log data, facilitating efficient debugging and performance analysis within ROS-based robotics projects. It aims to simplify the process of understanding and interpreting complex ROS logs, making it easier for developers to identify and resolve issues.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository hosts a collection of Jupyter Notebooks using Python to explore and analyze financial data, covering various projects related to personal finance and investment strategies. It demonstrates practical applications of Python libraries for financial modeling, data visualization, and potentially algorithmic trading, offering a hands-on learning resource for those interested in applying Python to finance.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project employing HTML and Python to create interactive and informative map visualizations. This repository showcases how to leverage web technologies and scripting to display geographical data, offering a user-friendly interface for exploring and understanding spatial information. The project focuses on practical application of data visualization techniques within a mapping context.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a simple CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, utilizing HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for various tasks. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of a basic web application and serves as a learning resource for understanding full-stack development with these technologies, covering topics like database interaction, web server deployment, and front-end design.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: Robofleet-dashboard is a project leveraging JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS to create a user interface for visualizing and interacting with the Robofleet robotics platform. This dashboard provides a web-based environment for monitoring robot status, displaying sensor data, and controlling robot operations, offering a comprehensive overview of Robofleet-connected devices and their activities.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern, responsive dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a practical example of implementing a dynamic user interface with features like data visualization, user management, and potentially authentication, providing a solid foundation for building data-driven web applications.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project utilizing TypeScript and JavaScript to build [Insert Project Goal Here - e.g., a robust task management application, a dynamic portfolio website, etc.]. This repository focuses on implementing [Mention key features or functionalities - e.g., real-time collaboration, interactive UI elements, etc.] and explores best practices in [Mention relevant areas - e.g., state management, component architecture, testing, etc.] within the chosen technology stack. This project aims to be a valuable resource and showcase for [Target Audience - e.g., developers, students, etc.] interested in modern web development techniques.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed as a project to explore modern web development techniques. This repository showcases a user-friendly interface for creating and participating in polls, demonstrating features like secure user authentication, real-time updates, and data persistence. It serves as a practical example of building a dynamic and interactive web application with a focus on clean code and best practices within the Next.js ecosystem.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide an interactive AI-powered conversational experience. It uses HTML and CSS for the frontend and JavaScript for enhanced functionality, serving as a practical project showcasing the integration of large language models with modern web development technologies.

title: resume
description: This repository houses the source code for my resume, built using LaTeX for precise formatting and potentially incorporating HTML for web presentation. It serves as a personal project showcasing my skills and experience, allowing for easy maintenance and version control while providing both printable and potentially web-viewable versions of my resume.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, serving as a dynamic platform for brainstorming, organizing, and developing ideas. This project leverages modern web development techniques to provide a user-friendly interface for managing and visualizing concepts, making it ideal for collaborative brainstorming sessions and personal project planning.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: This dynamic event calendar project, built with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, allows users to easily create and manage events with a visually appealing and interactive interface. It provides a flexible solution for displaying events on a calendar, making it a versatile tool for personal or organizational scheduling and event management.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, and Supabase for tracking IoT assets. It leverages TypeScript for robust type safety, TailwindCSS for streamlined styling, and Supabase for backend services like authentication and data storage, providing a comprehensive project demonstrating modern web development techniques applied to IoT asset management.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a project showcasing a dynamic and interactive web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository explores modern web development techniques to deliver [mention a key feature or functionality if available in the README, e.g., "an immersive map experience" or "a data visualization platform"]. It serves as a practical example and learning resource for front-end development.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a modern e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and React, showcasing a functional online fruit store. It leverages MUI for a responsive and intuitive user interface, and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching. This project demonstrates a practical application of key web development technologies for building performant and scalable e-commerce platforms, covering topics such as type safety, component-based architecture, and server-side rendering.
